newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: BADMINTON-INDONESIA'S SUSANTO WINS MALAYSIAN OPEN.
newsitem.headline: BADMINTON-INDONESIA'S SUSANTO WINS MALAYSIAN OPEN.

text.p: Indonesia's Hermawan Susanto clinched the $180,000 Malaysian Open badminton championship on Sunday when he beat Denmark's Peter Gade Christensen 15-11 15-11 in the final.
The 30-year-old Susanto, who put out top seed and former world champion Joko Suprianto of Indonesia in the semifinals, took just 45 minutes to defeat the 21-year-old Christensen.
The Indonesian showed composure in the first game, battling back after Christensen had taken a 9-6 lead.
In the second game Susanto got off to a fast start, leading 8-5 before Christensen drew level at 10-10.
The Indonesian then unleashed a series of smashes to put away the visibly tiring Christensen in the Likas Stadium in Malaysia's north Borneo city of Koto Kinabalu.
